sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Semilux Announces Receipt of Nasdaq Notification Regarding Minimum Bid Price Compliance
feed.summary: Semilux International Ltd. (NASDAQ: SELX) has received a notification from Nasdaq stating that the company is not in compliance with the minimum bid price requirement. The company's ordinary shares traded below $1.00 for 30 consecutive business days. Semilux has a 180-calendar-day compliance period, until May 11, 2026, to regain compliance and intends to monitor its share price and consider options, including a reverse stock split, if necessary.

feed.title: Semilux receives Nasdaq minimum bid price deficiency notice
feed.summary: Semilux International Ltd. received a deficiency notice from Nasdaq for failing to maintain a minimum bid price of $1.00 per share for 30 consecutive business days. The company's stock currently trades at $0.97. Semilux has until May 11, 2026, to regain compliance and may consider a reverse stock split.

feed.title: Semilux Faces Nasdaq Compliance Challenge Over Stock Price
feed.summary: Semilux International (SELX) has received a notification from Nasdaq due to its stock trading below the $1.00 minimum bid price for 30 consecutive business days. The company has until May 11, 2026, to regain compliance and is considering a reverse stock split as a potential solution. Semilux International Ltd., through its subsidiary TCO, specializes in optical and 3D sensing technology for various industries.

feed.title: Semilux International (NASDAQ: SELX) notified on minimum bid; compliance window to May 11, 2026
feed.summary: Semilux International (NASDAQ: SELX) has received a notification from Nasdaq for non-compliance with the minimum bid price rule, as its stock traded below $1.00 for 30 consecutive business days. The company has a 180-day period, until May 11, 2026, to regain compliance by achieving a closing bid price of at least $1.00 for 10 consecutive business days. Semilux plans to monitor its share price and may consider options like a reverse stock split to meet the Nasdaq requirement.
